column5: Good afternoon fellow Walleye fisherman, I am wondering if any of you have ever fished with sonars, jigging rapalas, sweedish pimples or Kastmasters in Canada in early June besides the traditional jig and twister tail? I was talking with an old timer who swears by them and always used them in Canada. What are thoughts and have you had success. Thank you, John in Ohio
Sonars late fall work good and for deep lakers anytime of year,others you mention don't know.
I would expect to lose a blade bait every few casts in Canada. The work great on walleye when the bottom isn't snaggy.
